greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = product of perfect divisors of n / n.
comment: A perfect divisor of n is a divisor d such that d^k = n for some k >= 1.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
formula: a(n) = A175068(n) / n. a(n) > 1 for perfect powers n = A001597(m) for m > 2.
mathematica: Table[Apply[Times, Select[Divisors@ n, Or[# == 1, #^IntegerExponent[n, #] == n] &]]/n, {n, 105}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Nov 21 2017 *)
results.author: _Jaroslav Krizek_, Jan 23 2010
